title: Designing Effective Teacher-Student Communication Strategies in Higher Education Language Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with digital learning tools and intermediate language proficiency (integrated reading/writing/speaking/listening)
context.additional_context: A project-based language learning process systematically applying asynchronous/synchronous digital communication channels (forums, blogs, wikis, chats) to improve learners' expressive skills, reading comprehension, and interaction abilities.

learning_goals: Learners will appropriately use various digital communication tools with instructors to resolve language-related issues (grammar errors, vocabulary choices, clarity of expression) that arise during project progress.

Through reflective reviews, learners will analyze the strengths and weaknesses of communication channels (text-based vs. voice-based) and select optimal tools for specific language learning contexts (e.g., writing feedback, oral presentation preparation).

Learners will document knowledge-building processes (collaborative text creation, feedback exchange) with peers and instructors using digital collaboration tools and produce feedback-reflected deliverables (e-portfolios).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
